main event: Multiple UFO sighting incidents in Bend, Oregon in 1949 involving civilian witnesses and the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics (NACA) Ames Laboratory personnel.
interesting points: Variety of objects sighted including circular, shiny, aluminum-like, cream-colored, and silvery objects.
Objects appeared to be of significant size, up to 30 feet in diameter, and traveling at high altitudes around 5000 to 10000 feet.
Witnesses observed objects drifting lazily, turning over constantly, or executing no maneuvers, suggesting non-conventional flight characteristics.
Some witnesses believed the objects to be sheets of paper or debris blown about by the wind, while others described them as resembling large commercial airplane shapes at cruising speed.
A range of credible civilian witnesses, including barbers, fishermen, and NACA Ames Laboratory personnel, provided consistent and detailed accounts of the sightings.
witnesses: civilians, including barbers, fishermen, and NACA Ames Laboratory personnel
